summary: This document is an email chain forwarding a Grand Jury subpoena response from American Airlines. An analyst at American Airlines, Donna Williams, provides travel records related to Ghislaine Maxwell in response to a subpoena. The email discusses obtaining a non-password-protected version of the attached records.

persons.name: Donna Williams
persons.context: American Airlines analyst who sent travel records related to Ghislaine Maxwell in response to a Grand Jury subpoena.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual whose American Airlines travel records were provided in response to a Grand Jury subpoena.

connections.description: Donna Williams, as an American Airlines analyst, provided Ghislaine Maxwell's travel records in response to a legal subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Response Sent
events.description: American Airlines analyst Donna Williams sent travel records related to Ghislaine Maxwell in response to a Grand Jury subpoena.

keyFacts: American Airlines provided Ghislaine Maxwell's travel records (passenger reservation records, ticket copies, usage information) in response to a Grand Jury subpoena.
The records were sent via email on February 5, 2020, by American Airlines analyst Donna Williams from the Corporate Security department.
The email chain shows coordination to obtain a non-password-protected version of the subpoenaed documents for investigative purposes.
